**Codes for Survival Analysis**^[See `childRmd/_survival.Rmd` file for other codes]



**calculate survival time**

```{r define survival time}
mydata$int <- lubridate::interval(
  lubridate::ymd(mydata$SurgeryDate),
  lubridate::ymd(mydata$LastFollowUpDate)
  )
mydata$OverallTime <- lubridate::time_length(mydata$int, "month")
mydata$OverallTime <- round(mydata$OverallTime, digits = 1)
```


```{r recode time, eval=FALSE, include=FALSE}
mydata$OverallTime <- mydata$genel_sagkalim
```

**recode death status outcome as numbers for survival analysis**

<!-- alive 0, death 1, punch cards -->

<!-- reference to addin -->


```{r recode death status outcome}
## Recoding mydata$Death into mydata$Outcome
mydata$Outcome <- forcats::fct_recode(as.character(mydata$Death),
               "1" = "TRUE",
               "0" = "FALSE")
mydata$Outcome <- as.numeric(as.character(mydata$Outcome))
```

**it is always a good practice to double-check after recoding**^[[JAMA retraction after miscoding â€“ new Finalfit function to check recoding](https://www.datasurg.net/2019/10/15/jama-retraction-after-miscoding-new-finalfit-function-to-check-recoding/)]

<!-- https://www.datasurg.net/2019/10/15/jama-retraction-after-miscoding-new-finalfit-function-to-check-recoding/ -->



```{r recode status}
table(mydata$Death, mydata$Outcome)
```

**Kaplan-Meier Plot Log-Rank Test**

```{r Kaplan-Meier Plot Log-Rank Test}
# Drawing Survival Curves Using ggplot2
# https://rpkgs.datanovia.com/survminer/reference/ggsurvplot.html
dependentKM <- "Surv(OverallTime, Outcome)"
explanatoryKM <- "LVI"

mydata %>%
  finalfit::surv_plot(.data = .,
                      dependent = dependentKM,
                      explanatory = explanatoryKM,
                      xlab='Time (months)',
                      pval=TRUE,
                      legend = 'none',
                      break.time.by = 12,
                      xlim = c(0,60)
                      # legend.labs = c('a','b')
                      )
```

**Univariate Cox-Regression**

```{r Univariate Cox-Regression}
library(finalfit)
library(survival)
explanatoryUni <- "LVI"
dependentUni <- "Surv(OverallTime, Outcome)"

mydata %>%
finalfit::finalfit(dependentUni, explanatoryUni) -> tUni

knitr::kable(tUni, row.names=FALSE, align=c('l', 'l', 'r', 'r', 'r', 'r'))
```

```{r}
tUni_df <- tibble::as_tibble(tUni) %>% 
  janitor::clean_names() 

tUni_df_descr <- paste0("When ",
                        tUni_df$dependent_surv_overall_time_outcome[1],
                        " is ",
                        tUni_df$x[2],
                        ", there is ",
                        tUni_df$hr_univariable[2],
                        " times risk than ",
                        "when ",
                        tUni_df$dependent_surv_overall_time_outcome[1],
                        " is ",
                        tUni_df$x[1],
                        "."
                        )


```

**Median Survival**

```{r Median Survivals}
km_fit <- survfit(Surv(OverallTime, Outcome) ~ LVI, data = mydata)
km_fit
# summary(km_fit)
```


```{r}
km_fit_median_df <- summary(km_fit)
km_fit_median_df <- as.data.frame(km_fit_median_df$table) %>% 
  janitor::clean_names() %>% 
  tibble::rownames_to_column()
```


```{r}
km_fit_median_df %>% 
  dplyr::mutate(
    description = 
      glue::glue(
      "When {rowname}, median survival is {median} [{x0_95lcl} - {x0_95ucl}, 95% CI] months."
    )
  ) %>% 
  dplyr::select(description) %>% 
  pull() -> km_fit_median_definition
```

```{r 1-3-5-yr}

```

```{r make df from survival summary}
km_fit_summary <- summary(km_fit, times = c(12,36,60))

km_fit_df <- as.data.frame(km_fit_summary[c("strata", "time", "n.risk", "n.event", "surv", "std.err", "lower", "upper")])

```



```{r print autoreport from survival summary df}
km_fit_df %>% 
  dplyr::mutate(
    description = 
      glue::glue(
      "When {strata}, {time} month survival is {scales::percent(surv)} [{scales::percent(lower)}-{scales::percent(upper)}, 95% CI]."
    )
  ) %>% 
  dplyr::select(description) %>% 
  pull() -> km_fit_definition
```

```{r arsenal survival, eval=FALSE, include=FALSE}
library(arsenal)
library(survival)

fit  <- coxph(Surv(fu.time, fu.stat) ~ age + sex + arm, data=mockstudy)
summary(fit)

fit.z <- cox.zph(fit)
fit.z

plot(fit.z[1], resid=FALSE) # makes for a cleaner picture in this case
abline(h=coef(fit)[1], col='red')


fit2 <- coxph(Surv(fu.time, fu.stat) ~ pspline(age) + sex + arm, data=mockstudy)
fit2

termplot(fit2, se=T, terms=1)

summary(fit2)$concordance

survConcordance(Surv(fu.time, fu.stat) ~ predict(fit2), data=mockstudy)


broom::tidy(fit)

broom::glance(fit)


summary(modelsum(Surv(fu.time, fu.stat) ~ arm, 
                 adjust= ~age + sex, data=mockstudy, family="survival"))


```

```r
library(survMisc)
# Contal C, O'Quigley J, 1999 An application of changepoint methods in studying the effect of age on survival in breast cancer. Computational Statistics & Data Analysis 30(3):253--70. http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0167947398000966{ScienceDirect}

data(kidtran, package="KMsurv")
k1 <- kidtran
k2 <- k1[k1$gender==1 & k1$race==2, ]
c1 <- coxph(Surv(time, delta) ~ age, data = k2)
cutp(c1, var="age", plot=TRUE)
k2 <- k1[k1$gender==2 & k1$race==2, ]
c1 <- coxph(Surv(time, delta) ~ age, data = k2)
cutp(c1, var="age")
```
